intro: Vincetoxicum sublanceolatum var. kinokuniense, commonly known as Japanese snakeroot, is a flowering plant native to Japan. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its slender, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its flowers are followed by capsule fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds. It is often used in traditional medicine and as an ornamental plant in gardens.
